Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk cockpit
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: cockpit bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: Cockpit is a server administration interface that makes it easy to administer GNU/Linux servers through a web browser. The cockpit packages have been upgraded to upstream version 118, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. Most notable changes are: SELinux audit failures can be diagnosed and solutions applied to the system Configure storage for Docker-formatted containers and images Volumes and environment variables can be configured for Docker containers Support PAM conversations on the Login screen, enabling two factor authentication Cockpit URLs can be proxied with a configured HTTP path prefix Timer jobs in systemd can be created and configured Display all managed NetworkManager devices Add support for network teams Prevent removal of last volume from volume group (BZ#1354421) Users of cockpit are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
